intro: Sieruela rutidosperma var. burmanni, commonly known as Burmann's sieruela, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
